paper_abstract: We develop an intersection type system for the (lambda) over bar mu(mu) over tilde calculus of Curien and Herbelin. This calculus provides a symmetric computational interpretation of classical sequent style logic and gives a simple account of call-by-name and call-by-value. The present system improves upon earlier type disciplines for (lambda) over bar mu(mu) over tilde: in addition to characterizing the (lambda) over bar mu(mu) over tilde expressions that are strongly normalizing under free (unrestricted) reduction, the system enjoys the Subject Reduction and the Subject Expansion properties. (C) 2008 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Characterizing strong normalization in the Curien-Herbelin symmetric lambda calculus: Extending the Coppo-Dezani heritage
